stories.text:
I am getting my resume together, about to start the job hunt for a security/red team role.

When I google my name, there is a twitter account that is my @lastnamefirstname (farily unique name); it has some pretty racist/right wing garbage posted.

I went through twitters' official "impersonation" channel (even though it's not really impersonating me), but they declined to take action.

Is this a liability in my job hunt? Is there a tactful way to say "Hey, if you google me, Im not this guy on twitter"?

I created a twitter account to have on my resume to "supersede" the one I don't control in the hopes that hiring managers would give the benefit of the doubt, but is there any other action I can take?
stories.title: Ask HN: Political Twitter account using my name/job search

stories.text:
I was wondering how the tech scene is doing there. The climate seems lovely and cost of life doesn't look too high.
Is that a good place for digital workers?
Does anyone have experience with freelancing and/or starting a company there?
stories.title: Ask HN: Anyone moved to/currently in the Canary Islands?
